index.html.title: index
index.html.description:
Ember Deck is a project still in early development, so this site may update and look unrecognisable after the fact!Said plainly, Ember Deck is a TTRPG Deckbuilder made for (ideally) 3-4 Player groups, but it should still scale relatively well until about 5-6 people. It was an idea heavily inspired by gems such as "Slay The Spire", "Hearthstone", "Slice and Dice", and "Morimens". The gameplay features tight resource management in a low-math, high-keyword environment, giving a couple of anchor points to make your own character and their deck unique and powerful, whereas the Setting provides plenty of opportunity for "angsty" or "against all odds" roleplay in a grimdark world, where magic is ubiquitous, but hope is scant.Once, there was HELL. Every day, souls passed in and out, getting incinerated and sent to the Hall of Echoes, pure. One day an apocalyptic event happened. Because of that, HELL is working overtime and is still centuries behind. Because of that, Souls get clogged up in the in-between, and that radiation is called magic, which seeps into the living. Until finally, their bodies can't take it anymore, and burn up from the inside.*The LORE dropdown is a good place to start for anyone curious about the world and the gritty reality found therein, ex.: VIBE. For the Rules Lawyers: here's the short end of it, as the detailed rulings fall under their own dropdowns, labelled BS, DS, or CHARACTER.Once a concept of who you'd like to play as forms in your mind, the preferable place to go is the CHARACTER>OATHS Section, where you'll find all three major Oaths (which function like classes, and determine your starting Attributes - Prisms), these in turn determine your Starting Deck.
All Oaths start with 10 BACKBONE cards making up their deck, but the keywords may vary based on chosen Oath and even subtle differences between the same Oath's decks are possible at times.
Now, having a concept, embodied by an Oath, and a Deck, you select your BURST, and your PASSIVES (Each Oath offers a different selection). These are the anchor points mentioned before - they'll define your playstyle heavily. Once that's in order, and your friends have done the same, you're set! (Don't forget to send at least 4 sentences worth of a backstory to your GM, though.) Changed Keyword function and Naming:
Empower -> Momentum.
Empower was Changed to provide a readily accessible pool instead of a small trickle.
Brace was updated to mirror this change.
Focus -> Empower.
Delay was Removed.
Ward now scales with Insight and prevents enemy keywords as well as statuses.
Added IMAGES sections across the vault to provide visuals.
CASE STUDY was removed for cleanup Certain notes have received related images inside the notes
CINDERS, and, HEARTHS AND EMBERS were moved to the FRACTIONS dropdown
The SYNC-AXIS is now more firmly tied to combat through the updated EMPOWERand BRACE keywords
BURST note was corrected, showing an improved formula for post-burst draw calculation
INVENTORY section was brushed up, adding needed specifications and removing unnecessary repetitions. Allowed Curios to have limited Mechanical value.
Clarified PIERCE's scaling
Removed false keyword scalings from GUILE, INSIGHT, and MIGHT
Clarified SHARDS in-combat effects, and removed Delay from the list.
Added the EXPLORATION section
Added Several Notes explaining the rules of EXPLORATION (NODE - RESTNODE - PATHNODE - UNKNOWNNODE - UNSTABLENODE - ENCOUNTER, and REFERENCE IMAGE)
Expanded the TURNS page with an infographic, which can also be found in ENEMIES>RULINGS
Added HEARTH SHEET as well as EMBER SHEET
Compiled existing notes into a single file Untitled
Streamlined LIGHTNING
Made the HOLLOW effect more inconvenient Changed the Oath of the Crucible to Oath of the Pyre for easier differentiation and recognition from Conduit
Introduced Party-influenced Status cards added when taking DMG at 0 VITALS and reshuffling the shared deck during prolonged combats
Added the DECK note for clarifications of card handling
Expanded on the Tools and Curios section within INVENTORY
Altered CHARACTER/OATHS/MISTWALKER/PASSIVES to DISCARDthe first status instead of resisting an enemy intent for wider versatility
Created Intent Loops for Firebomber.canvas and Cultist.canvas and deleted Cinder Goliath.png
Also added a short guide to reading Intent loops in the RULINGS section
Also in the RULINGS section, introduced a potentially volatile mechanic of Front and Back row enemies. To be tested.
Clarified interactions between MOMENTUM and AREA and LIGHTNING
Redefined OATH_OF_THE_PYRE CHARACTER/OATHS/PYRE/BURSTS to not rely on MOMENTUM so heavily, changing one entirely to propose a new playstyle

headers.heading: Welcome to the official Ember Deck Vault!

bs-(between-stabbings)/bs-rolls-(checks).title: BS ROLLS (CHECKS)
bs-(between-stabbings)/bs-rolls-(checks).description:
Used to resolve arguments or environmental obstacles. Pool: 2d6 Base + Prism X d6. Success: Each die showing 4, 5, or 6. Sixes count double.
Failure: Each die showing 3, 2, or 1. Ones count double.
Difficulty: DC 1-2: Standard task. DC 3: Strenuous. DC 4: Dangerous/Elite. DC 6+: Near-impossible.

bs-(between-stabbings)/level_up.html.title: LEVEL_UP
bs-(between-stabbings)/level_up.html.description:
Level-Ups occur during rests/between session, and, through SHARDS accumulated during travels allow for: Increasing a single Prism's Value (-5)
Removing Cards (-3) *A playerâ€™s deck must always contain at least 4 BACKBONE Cards.
Adding Keywords to Cards (-3 for Primary, -2 for Secondary and Tertiary, -1 for CURSES)
Purging STATUS cards (-3)
Adding new BACKBONE Cards (-2) Changing Keywords already on Cards (-2) Removing Keywords from Cards (+1)

bs-(between-stabbings)/shards.html.title: SHARDS
bs-(between-stabbings)/shards.html.description:
Shards are the universal currency of the Hearth. They act as both long-term progression and can be used as mid-combat consumables with EXHAUST:
Cost: 0 ENERGY.
Effect: Add one Secondary Non-Scaling Keyword (AREA DISCARD DRAW ECHO LIGHTNING PIERCE RETAIN VAMPIRIC.) to the next card played, OR
grant +1 ENERGY / +1 DRAW / STRIKE for 1 DMG. (Hard cap) Crushed Shards are gone forever and cannot be used for progression.

character/cards/keywords/primary/brace.h.title: BRACE
character/cards/keywords/primary/brace.h.description:
Pool of Value. When gaining GUARD you may expend any amount of stacks from the pool and add it to the total GUARD received. Pool decreases when HP damage is taken.
Depending on the SYNC-AXIS; Harmony - halve, rounding up. Discord - remove all stacks.
Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/counter.title: COUNTER
character/cards/keywords/primary/counter.description: Grants Value stacks. Deals Value DMG back when hit; halve stacks (round up) after each trigger. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/empower.title: EMPOWER
character/cards/keywords/primary/empower.description: Adds Value to the numeric effect of the next card played. Scales with INSIGHT

character/cards/keywords/primary/guard.h.title: GUARD
character/cards/keywords/primary/guard.h.description: Grants Value Block. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/mend.ht.title: MEND
character/cards/keywords/primary/mend.ht.description: Restores Value Vitality. Scales with INSIGHT

character/cards/keywords/primary/strike..title: STRIKE
character/cards/keywords/primary/strike..description: Deal Value DMG. Scales with MIGHT

character/cards/keywords/secondary/area..title: AREA
character/cards/keywords/secondary/area..description: Affects ALL enemies, or ALL allies.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/echo..title: ECHO
character/cards/keywords/secondary/echo..description: Retrigger previous card (with a matching Primary) with all values set to 1.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/light.title: LIGHTNING
character/cards/keywords/secondary/light.description: Hits two targets: One with the lowest and one with the highest HP.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/merci.title: MERCILESS
character/cards/keywords/secondary/merci.description: If target has 0 Block, add Value to DMG. Scales with MIGHT

character/cards/keywords/secondary/pierc.title: PIERCE
character/cards/keywords/secondary/pierc.description: Ignores Block up to Value. Uses the higher Prism Value. Scales with MIGHT OR GUILE, whichever's higher.

character/cards/status_cards/doubt.html.title: DOUBT
character/cards/status_cards/doubt.html.description: RETAIN At the end of turn, lose 1 BURSTcharge. UNPLAYABLE

character/cards/status_cards/injury.html.title: INJURY
character/cards/status_cards/injury.html.description: Cost: 2 Energy. RETAINEXHAUST. While in hand, your BURST is Locked.

character/cards/status_cards/panic.html.title: PANIC
character/cards/status_cards/panic.html.description: Cost: 1 Energy. DISCARD another card from your hand. It does not contribute to Burst Gauge when discarded this way. RETAIN

character/cards/status_cards/trembling.h.title: TREMBLING
character/cards/status_cards/trembling.h.description: Cost: 1 Energy. EXHAUST. While in hand, playing another card deals Self DMG = ENERGY cost of the card played.

character/cards/status_cards/wound.html.title: WOUND
character/cards/status_cards/wound.html.description: When drawn, take 2 PIERCE DMG. UNPLAYABLE

character/cards/backbone.html.title: BACKBONE
character/cards/backbone.html.description: Starter Cards with only One Keyword, they have an innate +3 Value. Backbone cards are limited to the single-keyword cards provided in the Starting Oath Deck. Adding any keyword or modifying them turns them into Custom cards, removing the +3 bonus. Likewise, removing extra Keywords from a CUSTOMS card brings it back to a Backbone once its left with just One Keyword. Deck Rule: A playerâ€™s deck must always contain at least 4 Backbone Cards.

character/cards/customs.html.title: CUSTOMS
character/cards/customs.html.description:
Custom Cards have more than One Keyword. Can be UNIQUE or upgraded from BACKBONE cards.
Card ENERGY Cost Scales with Keyword count (1:1), making complex cards more expensive to play.
They use only the related Prism's Value for effects, where applicable, without the BACKBONE reliability bonus.

character/cards/status.html.title: STATUS
character/cards/status.html.description:
STATUS cards are Negative effects applied by Enemies, Events, or through losing VITALS. Unless noted otherwise, these are UNPLAYABLE, and disappear at the end of combat.
STATUS cards are ownerless, and so are dealt out randomly from left to right to players with the least amount of STATUS cards in hand.

character/cards/unique.html.title: UNIQUE
character/cards/unique.html.description: Unique Cards are ones gained through Backstory, or Campaign Events, usually crafted by the GM.

character/oaths/conduit/bursts.html.title: BURSTS
character/oaths/conduit/bursts.html.description:
Enemy loses all GUARD and COUNTER.
STRIKE LIGHTNING BLEED/IGNITE.
Play up to INSIGHT cards for free, if they scale with INSIGHT (from other players too).
IGNITE 2 AREA (Enemies). Already IGNITE enemies take their total IGNITE stacks as DMG immediately.

character/oaths/conduit/oath_of_the_cond.title: OATH_OF_THE_CONDUIT
character/oaths/conduit/oath_of_the_cond.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 0 MIGHT
1 GUILE
2 INSIGHT You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of:
3x STRIKE
3x GUARD And,
4x EMPOWER Or;
4x MEND

character/oaths/conduit/passives.html.title: PASSIVES
character/oaths/conduit/passives.html.description:
When you trigger an ECHO keyword, the values are set to 2 (usually 1).
Your IGNITE effects deal damage at the start of the enemy's turn.
Allies can use your INSIGHT if its higher than theirs, when playing an INSIGHT-scaling card.
EMPOWER INSIGHT the first card played each turn.

character/oaths/mistwalker/bursts.html.title: BURSTS
character/oaths/mistwalker/bursts.html.description: Reduce the cost of all cards currently dealt to 1 this turn. Next card played this turn takes effect 2 extra times (so 3 activations total). Stun an enemy. (Pause their Intent) Draw Guile cards, regain 1 ENERGY, EXHAUSTall STATUScards currently dealt.

character/oaths/mistwalker/oath_of_the_m.title: OATH_OF_THE_MISTWALKER
character/oaths/mistwalker/oath_of_the_m.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 1 Might
2 Guile
0 Insight You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of:
3x Strike
5x Guard
2x Counter

character/oaths/mistwalker/passives.html.title: PASSIVES
character/oaths/mistwalker/passives.html.description:
Dealing unblocked HP damage grants +1 Burst Charge. Discard the first negative STATUS drawn each turn.
Start combats with Guile Brace/MOMENTUM.
Killing an enemy draws 1 Card OR grants 1 ENERGY.

character/oaths/burst.html.title: BURST
character/oaths/burst.html.description:
Each player has an individual Ember Gauge (0-10). Charging: Play: +1 Charge per 1 ENERGY spent on your cards.
Sacrifice: +2 Charges per 1 ENERGY cost of a card willingly discarded from hand. You still must pay the card's cost to discard it. Activation:
Costs 10 Charges and 2 ENERGY. Burst-Lock: Only one player can trigger a Burst per turn, and the Bursting Ember cannot generate Burst Charges on the turn they used their Burst. * Additionally, when drawing cards, the player that Bursted is excluded from the calculation (N-1 x 3) for that turn.

character/inventory.html.title: INVENTORY
character/inventory.html.description:
Inventory is strictly divided to separate narrative utility from mechanical progression. Tools (~3 Slots): Functional items (Rope, Flint/Steel, Chalk, Medicine). These grant Advantage (+1 Success) on specific BS ROLLS (CHECKS). Gatekeeping: Certain tasks (climbing a sheer cliff) are impossible (DC ) without the specific item (Rope). Curios (~3 Slots): Personal narrative items or unique trophies. These usually have zero mechanical weight and exist for character flavour or narrative purposes. Share Slots with Tools. Shards (Numerical Value): Weightless essence stored directly in the Emberâ€™s resonance. Coin Pouch: Traditional currency used for mundane trade (food, lodging, information).
Armaments (Swords, Staves, Plate) are Narrative Justifications. They do not occupy slots because they are the physical justification of your 10-card deck. A player doesn't "get a sword" for +1 DMG; they have Strike cards because they have a sword.
These are rare, non-consumable items that sit on the Hearth Sheet (Alongside VITALS, ENERGY, etc.).
They provide non-Oath CHARACTER/OATHS/CONDUIT/PASSIVES to the Hearth, but have either low number values, or specific conditions to make them click. Examples would Include: The Hearth is immune to the first Yellow (Disruptive) Intent of every combat.
When the Sync-Axis is in Harmony (+3 SYNC-AXIS), Mend effects are doubled.
Adds Pierce to the first Strike each turn.
The Hearth can carry 3 Artifacts (Active Passives) Shards do not count toward any inventory limits limit; they are stored within the "Ember Deck" itself. Torch Lantern Rope Lockpicks Crowbar Hammer & Spikes Rations Waterskin Chalk Compass Map Medical Kit Repair Kit Face Wrap A Curioâ€™s effect should be noticeable once every 2â€“3 fights, and never decisive. Curios can: modify a card tweak a keyword bend a rule slightly Curios should: compete with each other overwrite conflict subtly Should they be optimal? Absolutely not
Grants One of your STRIKE cards VAMPIRIC. If the card is ever removed, the effect is lost with it.
Grants One of your GUARD cards +1 to its Value. Gives +Dice on one check ever (fizzles out afterwards)
Counts as Two SHARDS (can be spent) If you don't draw any of your cards, you can draw 1 more card once per encounter.

ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/rulings.ht.title: RULINGS
ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/rulings.ht.description:
Enemies operate on fixed values and unique behaviours, ignoring player Prism constraints. This allows the GM to create "impossible" threats that require specific card or behaviour answers. An enemy's "Statblock" is essentially their Intent Loop/Algorithm + their HP. Ex.: Husk - 7 HP Intent: Strike (6) -> Guard (8) -> Strike (8) -> Guard (12) -> LOOP. This makes enemies predictable (rewards knowledge/experience and learning), and decreases GM's mental load drastically, while keeping the players on their toes whenever they meet something new. Enemies are tracked through an special sheet - the Intent Table The table is reserved for enemies' names (top and bottom rows) and HP (middle) tracking, while their Intent Tokens are laid out below, and resolved in the order indicated by the arrow. As shown on the right side of the table, enemies can either be in Front or Back. Enemies in the back cannot be attacked while enemies in Front remain. It also features space for the shared deck and the discard pile.BOXES:
Red - STRIKE (aimed at the Hearth)
Blue - Guard (Usually on itself, but full HP enemies can guard Damaged enemies)
Yellow - STATUS (shuffled into the shared deck immediately) Grey/Green - Mixed/Variables LINES: Red - If hit while showing this intent Blue - if took no DMG Yellow - if Ally died

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/energy..title: ENERGY
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/energy..description:
Used to play cards. The cost of a card equals the number of Keywords on it (Min. 1).
A Party's Energy Max is calculated as follows: N (no. Players) X 2

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/owner_p.title: OWNER_PRIORITY
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/owner_p.description: To prevent Alpha-gaming, the player who owns the card currently being played has Absolute Veto. They decide the targets, the timing, or whether to discard it for Burst charges. Negotiation and cooperation is encouraged, but the Owner's word is law.

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/sync-ax.title: SYNC-AXIS
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/sync-ax.description: The relationship between Embers dictates the combat playstyle. The scale ranges from -3 to +3, and is tied to ENERGY and DMG variables. | Level | State | Combat Bonus | Combat Penalty | |---|---|---|---| | +3 | Harmony | +3 Shared Energy per turn. | Take +1 incoming damage. | | +2 | Bonded | +2 Shared Energy per turn. | Take Full incoming damage. | | +1 | Aligned | +1 Shared Energy per turn. | Take Full incoming damage. | | 0 | Indifferent | No bonus energy. | No damage mitigation. | | -1 | Friction | 0 Bonus Energy. | Buffer: -1 DMG from all incoming hits. | | -2 | Distant | 0 Bonus Energy. | Buffer: -2 DMG from all incoming hits. | | -3 | Discord | -1 Max Energy. | Buffer: -3 DMG from all incoming hits. |

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/turns.h.title: TURNS
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/turns.h.description: Fights are a constant back-and-forth between the Hearthbound Embers and their opponents, following a simple flow: Players Regain ENERGY (N x 2) -> Players coordinate their actions, and lay out their cards in order of play -> The Cards take effect -> Enemies realise their signalled Intent -> The Enemies signal their next Intents -> Players Draw (N x 3) fresh cards -> REPEAT

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/vitals..title: VITALS
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/vitals..description:
This is the Sum of All Players' Prisms + N (no. Players) X 2 When Vitals hits 0, the deck's top card is flipped, and the owner must decide: Shatter: Permanently remove 1 of the CUSTOMS of their choice from the pool. Trauma: The player permanently reduces one Prism by 1.
Regardless of their decision, N X STATUS cards are shuffled into the shared deck. These cards are based on the Party's Oath choices:
OATH_OF_THE_MISTWALKER causes a MIST
OATH_OF_THE_PYRE cases an CHARACTER/CARDS/STATUS_CARDS/EROSION
OATH_OF_THE_CONDUIT causes a HOLLOW
Each subsequent hit also shuffles in an ASH card.
If the topdeck revealed card is a STATUS one itself, the player with the most BURST charge is the decisionmaker
When hit at 0 Vitals, it is also an option to Sacrifice oneself. The player's character dies, but, they release their BURST immediately, with no extra costs nor limitations. Their Cards are then taken ot of the deck, and replaced with HOLLOW.
Death can also occur when an Ember's Prism scores all hit 0. The Ember's cards are then still removed from the deck, but are not replaced with any STATUS cards.

lore/world/vibe.html.title: VIBE
lore/world/vibe.html.description: Low fantasy: magic is ubiquitous but weakened. People usually know someone who uses it for something more, but almost nobody can use it Well - in a controlled manner, while retaining power. Most common folk have a hard time with just one of these dimensions. Anyone can light a torch with a flick of their fingers, but someone with enough aptitude and strength to cast a ray of fire is one in a hundred, and those who survive it are one in a thousand. Dark Fantasy: The world is undoubtably a "Bad Place to Be in". People assume the worst in people, The weather usually sucks, and it is dangerous "out there" even for Embers. The environment is hostile, often shrouded in the GREY MIST, making travel suicidal without the light of a Hearth. Gritty: The players are not expected to be "heroes in shining armours, come to save the world". They can be, of course, if they will it, but morally grey and even antagonistic options are on the table still.

prisms/guile.html.title: GUILE
prisms/guile.html.description: Precision, resource management, and reactive defense. Keywords: Guard, BRACE, Counter, BLEED

prisms/insight.html.title: INSIGHT
prisms/insight.html.description: Tactical manipulation, force multiplication, and metaphysical stability. Keywords: EMPOWER, WARD, IGNITE, Mend.

prisms/might.html.title: MIGHT
prisms/might.html.description: Physical force, momentum, and brute-force attrition. Keywords: Strike, MOMENTUM, Merciless

character/cards/keywords/primary/bleed.h.title: BLEED
character/cards/keywords/primary/bleed.h.description: Deal Value DMG again at the end of enemy's turn, once. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/ignite..title: IGNITE
character/cards/keywords/primary/ignite..description: Deal 1 DMG at the end of the enemy's turn, then decrease stacks by 1. Scales with INSIGHT

character/cards/keywords/tertiary/discar.title: DISCARD
character/cards/keywords/tertiary/discar.description: Discard 1 card(s). Cards discarded this way give BURST charges equal to their cost (as if they were played), to their Owner.

character/cards/keywords/tertiary/exhaus.title: EXHAUST
character/cards/keywords/tertiary/exhaus.description: Cards with this keyword are removed from the deck after being played.

character/cards/keywords/tertiary/retain.title: RETAIN
character/cards/keywords/tertiary/retain.description: Card stays in hand if unplayed.

character/cards/keywords/tertiary/ward.h.title: WARD
character/cards/keywords/tertiary/ward.h.description: Negates the next negative STATUS or Keyword (except STRIKE) applied by an enemy. Scales with INSIGHT.

character/cards/keywords/curses.html.title: CURSES
character/cards/keywords/curses.html.description: Adding a CURSES Keyword to a card makes it add a random STATUScard into the shared deck when played, But, it reduces the card's overall cost by 2 ENERGY (effectively -1 reduction as CURSESare still technically keywords and so they increase a card's cost by 1).

character/cards/keywords/unplayable.html.title: UNPLAYABLE
character/cards/keywords/unplayable.html.description: Cards with this keyword cannot be played, only Discarded or Exhausted by the effects of other cards, BURST, or other means.

character/cards/status_cards/ash.html.title: ASH
character/cards/status_cards/ash.html.description: Cost: 2 Energy. EXHAUST when played. RETAIN

character/cards/status_cards/erosion.htm.title: EROSION
character/cards/status_cards/erosion.htm.description: Cost: 1 Energy. When drawn, take 1 DMG. DRAW 1 card when played.

character/cards/status_cards/hollow.html.title: HOLLOW
character/cards/status_cards/hollow.html.description: Cost: 1 Energy. No effect. Persists between encounters, but dissipates during a LEVEL_UP

character/cards/status_cards/mist.html.title: MIST
character/cards/status_cards/mist.html.description: When drawn, shuffle a MIST into the Draw Pile. RETAIN UNPLAYABLE

character/cards/keywords/primary/momentu.title: MOMENTUM
character/cards/keywords/primary/momentu.description:
Pool of Value. When dealing DMG with STRIKE you may expend any amount of stacks from the pool and add it to the STRIKE dealt. Pool decreases when HP damage is taken.
Depending on the SYNC-AXIS; Harmony - halve, rounding up. Discord - remove all stacks.
Scales with MIGHT
Momentum damage is never duplicated, multiplied, or applied to more than one enemy. In the case or AREA being present on the card triggering MOMENTUM, pick a single target to receive the extra damage. In the case of LIGHTNING, the Higher HP target takes the bonus.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/cin.title: CINDERS
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/cin.description: Just as there are the Hearthbonded Embers, there are also "stray Embers", or "Cinders". Embers without a Hearth, either because of tragedy, or neglect, they suffer alone. These individuals are a lore thing mostly, meaning - unplayable, and make for great adversaries. Ranging from "Mad geniuses" who "made it work", to individuals broken by trauma, lashing out at the unjust world. If bonding is so necessary, how do solo adversaries survive? They consume others. A Cinder doesn't have their Hearth; they seek Fuel. They kidnap low-aptitude people and "burn" through them to stabilize their own LORE/WORLD/CULTURAL PILLAR/RELIGION-PHILOSOPHY/EROSION. This gives the players a clear, gritty objective: stop the Cinder from using the local village as a life support. Cinder Status: If Cinders "lose their grip on reality," perhaps they are actually still "perceiving" the bond. They might be trying to talk to the ghosts of their former Hearth-mates, or their brains are permanently wired to receive signals that are no longer being sent. 7. Why Theyâ€™re Exceptionally Powerful Power isnâ€™t skill. Itâ€™s lack of restraint mechanisms. No bond damping No social checks No institutional oversight No long-term planning They burn hot, fast, and wrong. And they know it. Which makes them terrifyingly honest.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/crs.title: CRS
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/crs.description: Government-independent bodies that handle the population's EROSION. They set up facilities of cold stone and water to allow for safe venting, as well as taking in the "terminal" cases, which they handle out back. They wear layered uniforms, like toxic hazard workers. High-status, low-life-expectancy, trained to read early collapse signs. People accept: Lantern taxes Data indexing Witchhunt-like inspections Not because they trust authority, but because theyâ€™ve seen what happens when someone collapses in a crowd.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/hea.title: HEARTHS AND EMBERS
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/hea.description:
People with spiked Prism aptitudes. The cost of power is life. Embers suffer a shortened lifespan, burning their years away the moment this flame blooms within them for the first time. Despite that, it's a gift, one that manifests randomly and powerfully, and comes at a horrid price. Players are called Embers, groups of bonded Embers are called Hearths. This bond acts as a "Resonance Buffer," preventing the individuals from "detonating" or collapsing into a Hollow state. Hearths can form due to: Rituals done by the Embers themselves, or even without the Embers' choice/knowledge via grimoires or other artifacts. Life experiences: a Bond is likely to form during a shared traumatic event, or, for the lucky ones, it can build up after years of closeness with one another. Bonding with other Embers allows for cleaner channelling - which translates nicely into extra energy per party member. Because Embers forget their pasts (due to LORE/WORLD/CULTURAL PILLAR/RELIGION-PHILOSOPHY/EROSION), they often lack a traditional moral compass. They act on instinct, immediate survival, or the orders of whoever is currently guiding them. Partially. Hearth-members (Embers) are known to have blurry memories and little recollection of who they were before the "merge". The bond between them can also be strengthened or weakened by individual interactions, even to the point of breaking (which is a traumatic experience on its own) Everyone in a hearth is a bit of an anchor to everyone else. Usually the other members are enough to "ground" whoever's having a tough time, but in times of high stress the emotions may get amplified/cascaded
Yes! It is rare to survive a bond breaking, but those who do are called CINDERS, and often lose their grip on reality, turning away from society altogether Probably the second one. I'd imagine them being like social programs, which quickly turn into military ones The most impressive and threatening Embers are those who can output the most, at the smallest cost to their vitals The "Ship of Theseus" Dilemma: If a Hearth replaces a member who died, does the new member eventually "absorb" the residual memories of the previous occupant? This could lead to haunting internal monologues where an Ember cannot distinguish their own childhood from that of a dead stranger. Cascading Failure: If emotions are amplified/cascaded during stress, a single memberâ€™s panic attack could theoretically "overclock" the entire Hearth, leading to a collective burnup. This makes emotional discipline as vital as magical talent. Hearths: Distributed Containment (And Why 3â€“5 Is the Sweet Spot) A Hearth is a living heat-sharing network. Soul-binding isnâ€™t mystical romance. Itâ€™s engineering under duress. Why It Works (When It Does) Heat disperses across multiple vessels Panic dampens if others are stable Emotional regulation is forced by proximity Individual spikes become manageable averages You didnâ€™t choose 3â€“5 by accident. Thatâ€™s perfect: 2 is unstable (feedback loop) 6+ increases coordination failure 3â€“5 balances redundancy and control Someone absolutely did the math. On corpses.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/the.title: THE EARTHBOUND
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/the.description: These zealots believe in extremist pacifism, claiming that every life spared and death delayed brings HELL closer to catching up, and ridding the world of magic and GREY MIST.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/the.title: THE GREAT HEARTH
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/the.description: A movement striving to unite all of humanity in one giant Hearth, they believe that will stabilise everyone and bring about the harmony observed among the more stable Hearths. Their methods are faulty, unorthodox, and oftentimes forceful, which turned the public opinion against them after some disastrous attempts at joining 20 people on a city square that no longer exists...Individual identity is the problem. They talk about equilibrium and "global balance". Forced soul-binding rituals Artifact-driven mass merges City-scale bonding attempts Kidnapping Embers first (theyâ€™re â€œkeystonesâ€) Because every failure: Produces survivors who swear it almost worked. Creates permanent hot zones they interpret as â€œholy groundâ€. Generates Cinders they call Heralds.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/war.title: WAR
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/war.description: REDACTED

lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/wet.title: WET RATS
lore/world/cultural-pillar/fractions/wet.description: Black Market Releases, the best alternative to the CRS Because of course. Illegal venting in slums. Portable release charms. Collapse-for-hire sabotage. Most Hollow outbreaks trace back here. But the alternative, for the unfortunate, is so much worse.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/religion-phil.title: EROSION
lore/world/cultural-pillar/religion-phil.description:
Magic doesnâ€™t want to be inside you. Veins, fingernails, and even eyes may begin glowing in red/yellow hues. That's the usual sign of magic accumulation, which, if left untreated, can cause burnups ("treating it" means releasing the magic outward, which itself has a chance for burning the person, but also their surroundings if uncontrolled) Usually the Hearth's bond is enough to allow for venting as well as controlled releases of build up magic, but ice, water, and other means of staying cool are also in play The "end product" of the magic's effect on a human body is being turned into a Hollow - a husk-like zombie-like shell of a being A Hollow isnâ€™t undead in the usual sense. That implies animation, will, or purpose. This is worse. Magical collapse = total loss of soul containment. What remains is: A body whose tissues have been thermally vitrified from the inside out. A mind erased by overload. A shell still moving because the residual soul-heat hasnâ€™t dissipated yet. The Collapse Timeline Stage 1: The Burnups Chronic fever, ash coughing Skin cracking like fired clay Emotional flattening Fire responds too easily People at this stage know whatâ€™s coming. Stage 2: Breach One moment too much: A stored surge A panicked release A battlefield spike The soul-boundary fails. This is not an explosion. Explosions release energy outward. This is an implosion that's powerful enough to hit the outside too. Memory, identity, intent â€” gone, into the GREY MIST. Stage 3: Hollowing (fractions of a second after Breach) Organs char but donâ€™t fail completely Blood thickens into slag Nerves fire randomly from thermal stress The heart becomes a smouldering knot The person is already dead. The body just hasnâ€™t realized it yet. Stage 4: The Hollow Walks A Hollow: Avoids nothing Attacks nothing deliberately Moves toward thermal gradients â€” crowds, fires, battlefields Why? Because residual soul-heat seeks other heat to equalize with. Hollows drift toward the living. Thatâ€™s why theyâ€™re exterminated on sight. Moral Baseline Shift When everyone knows: Collapse is possible Hollows exist And they were people yesterday The moral bar drops. â€œIâ€™m a liar. Iâ€™m a cheat. But I havenâ€™t collapsed.â€ Thatâ€™s enough. Bravery gets you: Overexertion Battlefield surges Collapse Cowards: Flee early Hoard less power Survive. There is no redemption in collapse. No lesson. No chosen fate. A Hollow isnâ€™t punished, sinful, or unworthy. Theyâ€™re what happens when the system fails.



Just as Dangerous (For Different Reasons) Uncontrolled release doesnâ€™t just burn the caster â€” it disturbs the local atmosphere. Side effects: Fire behaving wrong (screaming flames, fire that resembles faces) Attracting Hollows Creating permanent hot zones

lore/world/cultural-pillar/religion-phil.title: HELL
lore/world/cultural-pillar/religion-phil.description: Why Hell Is Full: Hell isnâ€™t full because too many people sinned - Thatâ€™s propaganda. Hell is full because it was designed as a furnace, a bottleneck for the deceased, not the final destination. Souls entered Hell to be broken down, identity stripped, meaning burned off, residual energy vented safely. At some point: The inflow exceeded processing capacity the furnace mechanisms failed Hell stopped processing souls and started storing them. Consequences? Pressure builds, exhaust backs up, heat leaks. That leak is magic. Its like the world is on top of a radioactive dump, but instead of cancer, the people get EROSION.

lore/world/cultural-pillar/images.html.title: IMAGES

lore/world/physical-pillar/grey-mist.htm.title: GREY MIST
lore/world/physical-pillar/grey-mist.htm.description: While EROSION comes from the unprocessed, wandering Souls, the Mist is the Will. It doesn't carry emotions, its suffocatingly cold, and imbued with memories, beliefs. Venturing into it is almost guaranteed to cause hallucinations, temporary personality disorders, and psychosis from mind-homogenisation. The leak is global. Gravity, wind, and geography donâ€™t matter much when the source is below reality. Low light allows it to accumulate. Heat and light disperse it. Hence: Cities burn lanterns at noon Roads are lined with braziers Darkness isnâ€™t romantic â€” itâ€™s hazardous

lore/world/physical-pillar/images.html.title: IMAGES

bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/explo.title: EXPLORATION
bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/explo.description:
Exploration is done on a Hex-grid, where the contents of specific Hexes are revealed only a short distance away, but the path as a whole can be viewed instantly (Boardgame reality)
It is possible to split the party but doing so usually harbours more risk than reward.

bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.title: NODE - ENCOUNTER
bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.description: A node hosting a combat or social encounter, marked appropriately depending on the hostility of the situation and the threat level.

bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.title: NODE - PATH
bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.description: An empty hex, allows free travel at a steady pace

bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.title: NODE - REST
bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.description: A space designated for LEVEL_UP and rejuvenation

bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.title: NODE - UNSTABLE
bs-(between-stabbings)/exploration/node-.description: A node that creates a one-way path once crossed, cannot be crossed again.

ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/images.htm.title: IMAGES

character/oaths/pyre/bursts.html.title: BURSTS
character/oaths/pyre/bursts.html.description:
Sacrifice up to MIGHT VITALS, gain as much BRACE, and 2 X MOMENTUM
Gain GUARD = MIGHT X N
Strike with MOMENTUM multiplier (DMG = Strike X MOMENTUM, instead of Strike + MOMENTUM).
Mend Half Max VITALS, grant Might Burst charges to another Ember.

character/oaths/pyre/oath_of_the_pyre.ht.title: OATH_OF_THE_PYRE
character/oaths/pyre/oath_of_the_pyre.ht.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 2 Might
1 Guile
0 Insight You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of: Either;
6x Strike
4x Guard Or;
6x Guard
4x Strike

character/oaths/pyre/passives.html.title: PASSIVES
character/oaths/pyre/passives.html.description:
MEND Might VITALS at combat end.
If a STRIKE kills an enemy, all excess damage is applied the next (left to right) target.
Discarding for Burst charges grants+3 instead of +2 per ENERGY.
Whenever the Hearth takes VITALS damage, gain +1 Burst Charge.

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/deck.ht.title: DECK
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/deck.ht.description:
Each turn, players draw cards using the N x 3 formula, from the shared deck, and take their own cards into their Hands. STATUS cards are dealt out evenly as described.
The Hand limit is 5 cards, unless overruled by an Artefact or narrative effects. If you cannot hold any more cards, and they have already been drawn, they are moved to the discard pile immediately and generate no BURST charges while doing so.
Once the shared deck runs dry, a Reshuffle is necessary, however, each Reshuffle also adds N status cards, similar to the 0 VITALS situation.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_minCollapseDepth.description: Only allow outline items to be collapsed if they are at least this many levels deep in the tree.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
